name: abyss
comments: Since the default k-mer size to run an assembly is 64, we have compiled two additional images with --enable-maxk=128 and --enable-maxk=256.
Please see the documentation.
usual_invocation_specific_comments: The `k` parameter is the size of the k-mer. It can be changed to any odd number below the `maxk` value (see comments). The `name` parameter can be changed to any name without blank spaces.

name: adops-gui
description: Phylogenetics and detection of positively selected sites
comments: This is a GUI, thus there is no test data output for this image. You may have to run 'xhost +' first if you create a .sh file.
invocation_general: xhost + && docker run --rm -ti -e USERID=$UID -e USER=$USER -e DISPLAY=$DISPLAY -v /var/db:/var/db:Z -v /tmp/.X11-unix:/tmp/.X11-unix -v $HOME/.Xauthority:/home/developer/.Xauthority -v "/your/data/dir:/data" pegi3s/adops-gui bash -c /opt/ADOPS/run.sh
usual_invocation_specific_comments: This image does not have any parameters.

name: alphafold_db
test_invocation_specific: uniprotIDFile to the filename of the list of Uniprot ID's corresponding to the proteins that you want to obtain from AlphaFold. Each line in the file should contain only one Uniprot ID.

name: alter
comments: To see the ALTER help, just run help
usual_invocation_specific_comments: `output` to the actual name of your output file. `out_format` to the output format you intend to obtain (the allowed standard formats are: ALN, FASTA, GDE, MEGA, MSF, NEXUS, PHYLIP and PIR).

name: autoaugustus
comments: To see AUGUSTUS general parameters help, you just need to run: augustus --help.

name: bdbm
comments: This is a GUI, thus there is no test data output for this image. You may have to run 'xhost +' first if you create a .sh file.
usual_invocation_specific_comments: This image does not have any parameters.

name: bioconvert
description: Interconversion of life science data formats
usual_invocation_specific_comments: 'bioconvert-conversion-name' to the name of the conversion command (e.g. fastq2fasta).

name: bwa
usual_invocation_specific_comments: `command` to the specific command of the BWA tool. `options` to the specific options of the BWA tool (these options will include the input/output files, which should be referenced under /data/.

name: clustalomega
usual_invocation_specific_comments: `output.fasta` to the actual name of your aligned FASTA file.

name: coral
usual_invocation_specific_comments: Note that the `-f` parameter indicates that the input file is in FASTA format (-fq for FASTQ files, -fs for Solexa FASTA files). `ouput.fasta` to the actual name of your ouput file.

name: cport
usual_invocation_specific_comments: 'chain_id' to indicate the identifier of the chain you want to use. `--pred` method to indicate the method you want to use.

name: cport-like
comments: To run the custom batch script that allows running in batch mode PDB files and get results in csv format, you should create a file named config in your working directory with the following information (one instruction per line):
input_dir=
chain=
method=
Check the Docker documentation for additional information regarding the number of retries or the wait interval for a specific method

name: cutadapt
comments: To see the Cutadapt⁠ help, just run -h.
usual_invocation_specific_comments: `output.fq` to the actual name of your output file. A negative value after `-u` would trims reads at the end.

name: diamond
usual_invocation_specific_comments: 'command' to the name of the DIAMOND command you want to use. 'options' with the specific options of the DIAMOND application (these options must include the input/output files, which should be referenced under /data/; see Docker instructions for further details).

name: ditasser_db
usual_invocation_specific_comments: The 'uniprotlistFile' should contain the UniProt numbers, one per line.

name: dnasp-v6
comments: This is a GUI, thus there is no test data output for this image. You may have to run 'xhost +' first if you create a .sh file.
invocation_general: docker run -it --rm --env="DISPLAY" --volume="${XAUTHORITY:-${HOME}/.Xauthority}:/root/.Xauthority:ro" --volume="/tmp/.X11-unix:/tmp/.X11-unix:ro" -v=/your/data/dir:/data --hostname="$(hostname)" pegi3s/dnasp-v6 wine "/wineuser/.wine/drive_c/Program Files (x86)/DnaSP v6/DnaSP6.exe"
usual_invocation_specific_comments: This image does not have any parameters.

name: edena
comments: To see the Edena⁠ help, just run the docker image without any parameters.
usual_invocation_specific_comments: /data/result to point to the prefix of the output files that will be generated by Edena.

name: emboss
comments: To obtain the help of an application, you just need to run: emboss-application-name -h (e.g. prophet -h)
usual_invocation_specific_comments: `emboss-application-name` to the name of the EMBOSS application you want to use. `options` with the specific options of the EMBOSS application (these options must include the input/output files, which should be referenced under /data/.

name: entrez-direct
description: NCBI E-utilities on the Unix Command Line
usual_invocation_specific_comments: `entrez-direct-command` to the name of the Entrez Direct command you want to use. `options` with the specific options of the Entrez Direct command (these options must include the input/output files if required, which should be referenced under /data/.)

name: fastroot
usual_invocation_specific_comments: 'method' to either MP (midpoint), MV (minVAR), OG (outgroup), or RTT (root-to-tip). If using OG, the `-g` option can be used to specify the outgroups. If more than one, put them between quotes. 'output' to the actual name of your Newick output file.

name: fasttree
comments: To see the FastTree⁠ help, just run FastTree -help.
usual_invocation_specific_comments: `output` to the actual name of your output file.

name: feature-counts
comments: The bam file must contain the alignment file in bam format.
usual_invocation_specific_comments: 'output.txt' to the actual name of your output file.

name: figtree
comments: This is a GUI, thus there is no test data output for this image. You may have to run 'xhost +' first if you create a .sh file.
invocation_general: docker run --rm -ti -e USERID=$UID -e USER=$USER -e DISPLAY=$DISPLAY -v /var/db:/var/db:Z -v /tmp/.X11-unix:/tmp/.X11-unix -v $HOME/.Xauthority:/home/developer/.Xauthority --device /dev/dri/ -v "/your/data/dir:/data" pegi3s/figtree
usual_invocation_specific_comments: This image does not have any parameters.

name: flash
comments: To see the FLASH⁠ help, just run --help.

name: freebayes
usual_invocation_specific_comments: 'reference.fa' to the actual name of your reference file (rCRS.fasta is included with the docker image).

name: gatk-4
comments: To see GATK 4 available tools, just run gatk --list (please note that GATK 4 does not include some tools that are included in GATK 3⁠).
To obtain the help of a particular tool, you just need to run: gatk tools --help (where tools is the tool name)
usual_invocation_specific_comments: `tools` to the name of the GATK 4 tool you want to use. `options` with the specific options of the GATK 4 tool (these options must include the input/output files, which should be referenced under /data/).

name: gatk-3
comments: To see GATK 3 options and available tools, just run java -jar /opt/GenomeAnalysisTK.jar -h.
usual_invocation_specific_comments: `tools` to the name of the GATK 3 tool you want to use. `options` to the specific options of the GATK 3 tool (these options will include the input/output files, which should be referenced under /data/).

name: getpdb
usual_invocation_specific_comments: Only one UniProt number can be specified in the `uniprotFile`.

name: gmap-gsnap
usual_invocation_specific_comments: `genome_name` to a given name. `k_mer`_value to the value of the k-mer size you want to use. `output` to the actual name of your output file.

name: goalign
usual_invocation_specific_comments: 'goalign-application-name' to the name of the Goalign application you want to use. 'output' to the actual name of your output file.

name: gotree
usual_invocation_specific_comments: 'gotree-application-name' to the name of the Gotree application you want to use. `output` to the actual name of your output file.

name: graphviz
comments: Before using the graphviz image, you must prepare the file containing the instructions for building the graph as pairs of objects. Please see the test data for inspiration

name: haplogrep
usual_invocation_specific_comments: 'out.txt' to the desired name of the output file. You may also want to replace phylotree-rcrs@17.2 for another reference sequence.

name: human_prot_atlas
description: Filtering UniProtKB identifier lists based on Human Protein Atlas tissues
usual_invocation_specific_comments: 'output.txt' to the actual name of your output TXT file with the filtered identifiers.

name: hyphy
comments: To see the HyPhy help, just run HYPHYMP -h.

name: id-mapping
comments: The valid names for FROM_DB and TO_DB can be obtained with docker run --rm pegi3s/id-mapping list-from-dbs and docker run --rm pegi3s/id-mapping list-to-dbs, respectively. The script`s help can be obtained with --help.
usual_invocation_specific_comments: `FROM_DB` to the actual name of the source database of the input identifiers. `TO_DB` to the actual name of the destination database. `output.tsv` to the actual name of your output TSV file.

name: igv
usual_invocation_specific_comments: This image does not have any parameters.

name: kakscalculator
comments: The CDS sequences in the fastaFile must be aligned (with no sequence line breaks).
The first nucleotide must correspond to the first codon position. To see the KaKs Calculator help, just run "KaKs_Calculator -h".

name: mafft
comments: To see the MAFFT help, just run mafft --help.
usual_invocation_specific_comments: output.fasta to the actual name of your aligned FASTA file.

name: mauve
usual_invocation_specific_comments: `output` to the actual name of your output file.

name: mauve (gui)
comments: To run the Mauve GUI you may have to run 'xhost +' first if you create a .sh file, but you may also run this program using the CLI.
invocation_general: docker run --rm -ti -e USERID=$UID -e USER=$USER -e DISPLAY=$DISPLAY -v /var/db:/var/db:Z -v /tmp/.X11-unix:/tmp/.X11-unix -v $HOME/.Xauthority:/home/developer/.Xauthority -v "/your/data/dir:/data" pegi3s/mauve
usual_invocation_specific_comments: This image does not have any parameters.

name: maxbin2
description: Software for binning assembled metagenomic sequences

name: megax
invocation_general: docker run --rm -ti -e USERID=$UID -e USER=$USER -e DISPLAY=$DISPLAY -v /var/db:/var/db:Z -v /tmp/.X11-unix:/tmp/.X11-unix -v $HOME/.Xauthority:/home/developer/.Xauthority --device /dev/dri/ -v "/your/data/dir:/data" pegi3s/megax megax

name: metaeuk
usual_invocation_specific_comments: `module_name` to the name of the module to be used. `options` to the module name options

name: ncbi_retrieve
comments: The assembly option no longer works in versions prior to 1.0.1 due to changes in NCBI database structure

name: newick_utils
usual_invocation_specific_comments: `your_command` to the Newick Utilities command you want to perform.

name: omegamap
usual_invocation_specific_comments: `25000` may be replaced with the actual number of iterations you want to perform.

name: phipack
usual_invocation_specific_comments: `output` to the actual name of your output file.

name: plasflow
usual_invocation_specific_comments: The default value for the threshold value is 0.7 but this can be changed by replacing 0.7 by another number

name: plottree
usual_invocation_specific_comments: The plottree arguments (fontsize (-s), width (-w), and height (-l)) can be changed to suit your needs. You may also change `output` to the desired name of your output file.

name: popart
invocation_general: docker run --rm --env QT_X11_NO_MITSHM=1 -ti -e USERID=$UID -e USER=$USER -e DISPLAY=$DISPLAY -v /var/db:/var/db:Z -v /tmp/.X11-unix:/tmp/.X11-unix -v $HOME/.Xauthority:/home/developer/.Xauthority -v "/your/data/dir:/data" pegi3s/popart

name: probcons
usual_invocation_specific_comments: `output.fasta` may be changed to the output desired name

name: pymol
invocation_general: docker run --rm -ti -e USERID=$UID -e USER=$USER -e DISPLAY=$DISPLAY -v /var/db:/var/db:Z -v /tmp/.X11-unix:/tmp/.X11-unix -v $HOME/.Xauthority:/home/developer/.Xauthority --device /dev/dri/ -v "/your/data/dir:/data" pegi3s/pymol pymol

name: r_data-analysis
description: R image with common data analysis libraries such as caret, dplyr, ggplot2, etc.
comments: You must provide an R script File that ends with .R. See the test data for inspiration.

name: r_deseq2
comments: You must provide an R script File that ends with .R. See the test data for inspiration.

name: r_edger
comments: You must provide an R script File that ends with .R. See the test data for inspiration.

name: r_enhanced-volcano
comments: You must provide an R script File that ends with .R. See the test data for inspiration.

name: r_network
description: R image with data analysis libraries for network analysis, built on top of r_data-analysis.
comments: You must provide an R script File that ends with .R. See the test data for inspiration.

name: r_venn-diagram
description: Creation of Venn and Euler plots
comments: You must provide an R script File that ends with .R. See the test data for inspiration.

name: raxml
usual_invocation_specific_comments: `-m` to specify the desired model, and -p to use a fixed seed number

name: repeat_masker
usual_invocation_specific_comments: `drosophila` could be changed to any other species name in the Dfam library.

name: rootdigger
usual_invocation_specific_comments: The value of the `--mode` parameter can be either `exhaustive` or `early-stop`.

name: seda
comments: This is a GUI, thus there is no test data output for this image. You may have to run 'xhost +' first if you create a .sh file. Due to changes in the structure of the NCBI website, the "NCBI rename" option no longer works in versions prior to 1.6.1
invocation_general: xhost + && docker run --rm -ti -e USERID=$UID -e USER=$USER -e DISPLAY=$DISPLAY -v /var/db:/var/db:Z -v /tmp/.X11-unix:/tmp/.X11-unix -v $HOME/.Xauthority:/home/developer/.Xauthority -v "/your/data/dir:/data" -v /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock -v /tmp:/tmp pegi3s/seda
usual_invocation_specific_comments: This image does not have any parameters.

invocation_general: docker run --rm -ti -e USERID=$UID -e USER=$USER -e DISPLAY=$DISPLAY -v /var/db:/var/db:Z -v /tmp/.X11-unix:/tmp/.X11-unix -v $HOME/.Xauthority:/home/developer/.Xauthority -v "/your/data/dir:/data" pegi3s/splitstree

name: velvet
description: Sequence assembler for very short reads

name: whiscy
description: Identification of active and passive sites
comments: No longer works because the database upon which Whiscy relied is no longer available.

name: cport_server
comments: No longer works because some of the servers upon which CPORT relied stopped working.

name: evoppi-querier
description: Making queries to the EvoPPI web server

name: gbif_gis
usual_invocation_specific_comments: `species_name` to the name of the species of interest, for instance, `Solanum acaule*`.

name: gis

name: taxodros_gis
usual_invocation_specific_comments: `melanogaster 1` can be changed to the name of any other taxodros name

name: auto-pss-genome
description: Automatic detection of positively selected sites in complete genomes

name: check-cds
description: Compi pipeline to produce valid CDS files

name: pss-fs

name: trinity

name: biopython
description: Multipurpose Python tools for computational molecular biology
